newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: PDVSA to re-offer Catatumbo block in 1st half 1997.
newsitem.headline: PDVSA to re-offer Catatumbo block in 1st half 1997.

text.p: Venezuela's state oil company Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) plans to re-offer a profit sharing contract for exploration and production in the Catatumbo block in the first half of next year, a top company official said Friday.
"The Catatumbo area should be offered under broadly the same arrangement in the first half of 1997," Juan Szabo, coordinator of exploration and production, told reporters at a breakfast meeting.
Catatumbo, located on the southwestern shore of Lake Maracaibo, was one of two areas which PDVSA failed to allocate during a bidding round for 10 new areas in January.
"The problem with Catatumbo was the lack of geological information," Szabo said.
Exploration and surveys in areas adjacent to the block should provide potential bidders with enough information to make the block attractive, he added.
The Sombrero block in central western Venezuela which was also rejected by bidders in January's auction, meanwhile, is still restricted by low natural gas prices, Szabo said.
"This area contains a lot of gas related to crude and prices for gas are very low," Szabo said.
Szabo said the Sombrero area could be re-offered if natural gas prices improved.
